TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit WebBrowsableAttribute extends System.Attribute
Public NotInheritable Class WebBrowsableAttribute Inherits Attribute
public ref class WebBrowsableAttribute sealed : Attribute

Docs.summary: Indicates whether the designated property of a Web Parts control is displayed in a object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PropertyGridEditorPart> control provides a generic user interface (UI) that enables users to edit custom properties on <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> and server controls placed in <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneBase> zones. The editing UI is provided for properties that are marked in the source code with the `WebBrowsable` attribute (from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebBrowsableAttribute> class). When a property is marked with this attribute, a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PropertyGridEditorPart> control creates the editing UI based on the type of the property, and uses a <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor> object if needed to convert the value in each editing control to the type of the property.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebBrowsableAttribute> attribute to mark a property on a Web Parts control as available to be displayed in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PropertyGridEditorPart> control. This example is part of a larger example found in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PropertyGridEditorPart> class overview.
[!code-csharp[WebParts_PropertyGridEditorPart_Overview#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/WebParts_PropertyGridEditorPart_Overview/CS/userinfowebpart.cs#6)] [!code-vb[WebParts_PropertyGridEditorPart_Overview#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/WebParts_PropertyGridEditorPart_Overview/VB/userinfowebpart.vb#6)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebBrowsableAttribute.%23ctor%2A> constructor is used when the `WebBrowsable` attribute is applied through the attribute declaration `[WebBrowsable()]` in C# or `<WebBrowsable()>` in Visual Basic.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebBrowsableAttribute> attribute to mark a property on a Web Parts control as available to be displayed in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PropertyGridEditorPart> control. The property is set as browsable through the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebBrowsableAttribute.%23ctor%2A> constructor. This example is part of a larger example found in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PropertyGridEditorPart> class overview.
[!code-csharp[WebParts_PropertyGridEditorPart_Overview#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/WebParts_PropertyGridEditorPart_Overview/CS/userinfowebpart.cs#6)] [!code-vb[WebParts_PropertyGridEditorPart_Overview#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/WebParts_PropertyGridEditorPart_Overview/VB/userinfowebpart.vb#6)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebBrowsableAttribute.%23ctor%2A> constructor is used when the `WebBrowsable` attribute is applied through the attribute declaration with a Boolean value. To prevent a property from being displayed in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PropertyGridEditorPart> control, the property could be marked with the attribute `[WebBrowsable(false)]` in C# or `<WebBrowsable(false)>` in Visual Basic.
